result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas James Rinzel

defendant.name: Rinzel, Nicholas James
defendant.address: 10211 West Greenfield Avenue,10, West Allis, WI 53214

records.addlTxt: Jury instructions for plea; Received and Filed.
Pretrial incarceration credit; Received and Filed.

Defendant Nicholas James Rinzel in court, in custody.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for Nicholas James Rinzel.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 30 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 15 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 15 MONTHS, consecutive to Count 2, concurrent to case 22CM871, credit for 28 days. 

AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant ordered to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 90 days time served, consecutive to count 1, concurrent to case 22CM871.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSTION.

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 30 months with the following conditions:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- AS TO COUNT 1: Court ordered 30 days condition time, stayed at the discretion of the probation agent.
- Complete a batters intervention program.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random UA's.
- No use of possession of firearms.
- Full time work, 
- No contact with victim, unless changed by agent and only with victim's request.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Pay the Domestic Abuse Assessment fee.

- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA and DV) during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.  If defendant it revoked, pay all mandatory Court costs and all applicable surcharges (including the DV and DNA surcharge) and assessments which are to be collected by DOC at a rate which the department deems reasonable from the defendant's funds and during extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Defendant advised that as a convicted felon s/he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also s/he may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.

Defendant advised of appeal rights.

Defendant Nicholas James Rinzel in court, in custody.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for Nicholas James Rinzel.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3:  Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she must submit a DNA sample and may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his/her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights are restored.

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed but read-in for sentencing purposes.

Defendant Nicholas James Rinzel not in court, in custody.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for Nicholas James Rinzel.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
CASE CALLED FOR BR. 36.  Court will allow transfer of this case for global resolution.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas James Rinzel not in court, in custody.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for Nicholas James Rinzel.  Attorney Michael Staskunas for Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for global resolution with case 22CM871.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State Motion to Join Cases and Re-Assign to Domestic Violence Court.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Nicholas James Rinzel in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Nicholas James Rinzel in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Elaine Fehrs.
Case in court for an arraignment.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense is waiting for discovery and offer from the State.  Court accepts transfer of case from Branch 41 for possible global resolution.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas James Rinzel in court with Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Nicholas James Rinzel in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Detective J. Cerqua. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy. Defense requests an arraigment date and to be heard on bail.     
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Arraignment scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report (New Criminal Charge) received and filed.
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Danielle W.

DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES THIS CASE WAS HEARD OFF THE RECORD.
Defendant Nicholas James Rinzel in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Nicholas James Rinzel in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nicholas James Rinzel appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
